meanings.definition: A condition of agonizing struggle or trouble.
meanings.sent1: She was in the throes of a difficult decision.
meanings.sent2: The country was in the throes of a financial crisis.
meanings.sent3: In the throes of chaos, she found a moment of clarity.
meanings.sent4: The throes of despair gripped her heart tightly.
meanings.sent5: The throes of pain twisted her face into a grimace.

meanings.sent1: He was in the throes of jealousy when he saw them together.
meanings.sent2: The actress experienced the throes of excitement before going on stage.
meanings.sent3: In the throes of laughter, she accidentally snorted.
meanings.sent4: The throes of anger clouded his judgment.
meanings.sent5: The throes of love overwhelmed her senses.
